alert.note: Alert for Boulder And Jefferson Counties Below 6000 Feet, West Broomfield County; Jefferson and West Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Northeast Park Counties Below 9000 Feet; Larimer and Boulder Counties Between 6000 and 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 31 at 2:11PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Gilpin, east central Clear Creek, northwestern Jefferson and southeastern Boulder Counties through 300 PM MDT... At 211 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles southwest of White Ranch Open Space, or 22 miles west of Denver, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Northwestern Arvada, southwestern Boulder, Lafayette, Golden, Louisville, Idaho Springs, Nederland, Central City, Black Hawk, Rollinsville, Rocky Flats, Eldorado Springs, White Ranch Open Space, Pinecliffe, Bergen Park and Floyd Hill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Boulder And Jefferson Counties Below 6000 Feet, West Broomfield County; Jefferson and West Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Northeast Park Counties Below 9000 Feet; Larimer and Boulder Counties Between 6000 and 9000 Feet
